intro: Dalechampia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often deeply lobed and have a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and potential ornamental value.
